vation  of  a  child  to  learn,”  but  these  factual  studies  could  not  determine
whether lowered motivationto learn counts as lowered opportunityto learn. The
Court had to decide this issue because it in effect determines what the law is—
what it prohibits and what it allows. Thus, what was presented as a question
of fact turned out to be at least partly a question of law. In such cases, it is not
clear where law ends and facts begin.
